Agricultural Holdings Acts (Amendment) Bill, Memorandum.by'the Minister of Agriculture and Fisheries.On Friday next two private members' bills dealing with agricultural subjects will come before the House of Commons, for second reading; copies appended herewith.The Railway Fires Bill purports to enable an owner whose land is injured by sparks from a railway engine to recover compensation without proof of negligence up to 200 instead of 100 as allowed by the K?.il'.'-ay Fires Act. 1905. The Bill passed second reading In the House of Commons last session by 134 to 27 and went through Committee -ithout amendment.The Agricultural Holdings Act (Amendment) Bill enables p. tenant to trer,t as his landlord, for the purpose of serving any notice, the person to whom he has been paying his rent until he has received written notice that some other person has become his landlord. The bill is promoted by the Agricultural Committee of the House of Commons and seems a harmless measure.With the consent of my colleagues I should like to say that the Government regards both bills with favour *R.
